poem:
The Fall at Uffizi

In a room of hushed echoes,  
against time's trust,  
a careless step—  
brushing princely robes  
with transient fame's gust.  
A stumble,  
memes born in folly's shadow,  
and history's face scuffs  
under a laughing lens—  
300 years for this moment:  
art,  
gravity,  
and the fragile dance of being.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Three-hundred-year-old painting in the Uffizi damaged after visitor trips while trying to ‘make a meme’ A 300-year-old painting in Florence’s Uffizi Gallery has allegedly been damaged after a visitor tripped while posing for a photo with the artwork. The Uffizi said the painting, a portrait of Tuscan prince Ferdinando de’ Medici painted by Anton Domenico Gabbiani in 1712, was damaged after a visitor fell backwards while attempting to “make a meme” in front of it". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Three-hundred-year-old painting in the Uffizi damaged after visitor trips while trying to ‘make a meme’ A 300-year-old painting in Florence’s Uffizi Gallery has allegedly been damaged after a visitor tripped while posing for a photo with the artwork. The Uffizi said the painting, a portrait of Tuscan prince Ferdinando de’ Medici painted by Anton Domenico Gabbiani in 1712, was damaged after a visitor fell backwards while attempting to “make a meme” in front of it
